issue.title: stwater.co.uk
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Content Blocker

### AdGuard version

2.1.72.49

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly, Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.stwater.co.uk/in-my-area/check-my-area/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Send Do-Not-Track signals

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Comment

When any of the filters listed are enabled, the page doesn't load and only returns a white screen. This is blocking a cookie screen that is needed to progress to the next screen.

* AdGuard Annoyances filter
* AdGuard – Cookie Notices

2. Screenshots

* Filters enabled - https://i.imgur.com/obNwjhA.png
* Filters disabled - https://i.imgur.com/mAZBdV3.png

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Maybe we could add something like this (seems to works fine on my end):
```adblock
healthline.com#%#(()=>{const t=[];t.push=function(t){"object"==typeof t&&t.events&&Object.values(t.events).forEach((t=>{if("function"==typeof t)try{t()}catch(t){}}))},window.AdBridg={cmd:t}})();
```
to fix issue caused by DNS filtering.

issue.title: cheaperthandirt.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://cheaperthandirt.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fcheaperthandirt.com) ### Comment Username: @JohnStephenSimonJr > When I receive emails from CheaperThanDirt.com and I click on links, with my AdGuard on, I get a message from Microsoft (Edge, Windows something) that says "Hmmm, Can't link that page." There is a reference to exponea.com. When I clink on links, with my AdGuard off, I go to the CheaperThanDirt page. > > If you look at the Email page I have my cursor on hover and you can see the link is directing me to exponea.com initially which is then, after logging me personally as responding to the email, is directing me to the CheaperThanDirt page. > > I looked up exponea.com and it appears to be a legitimate service that outsources management of web based marketing and loyalty programs for various businesses. I have the same issue with OluKai.com and Lenovo US where I am also a customer with some slight variations, same result - blocked email link. My semi-educated guess is that something in how exponea grabs my response to track me before sending me to their customer's website sets off AdGuard as I have it configured. I am guessing that exponea has their system set-up so that if the tracking info is blocked, they don't put the link request through, and the DNS error results.
